did.unittitle: Philadelphia Museum of Art Building Department records

bioghist.p: George C. A. Barbour, a construction engineer for the Fairmount Museum project, was appointed Superintendent of the new building at its opening in 1928. With Memorial Hall's continued operation, Barbour's office was designated as "Buildings" to reflect both facilities. He served as General Superintendent until his retirement in 1961, at which time Alan Corson, Jr. assumed the position. Robert Lipsey succeeded Corson, serving from 1969 to 1978. During these tenures, the office designation changed. From 1949 to 1952, the General Superintendent position was simply considered part of the administrative staff. In 1953, Barbour headed "Construction and Operation," with Jane Edmiston as Personnel and Budget Officer. In 1971, at the time of Lipsey's tenure, the General Superintendent became a City appointment, along with the newly-created position of Engineer Technician, held by Walter Cheatham. Edmiston also became a City employee, with her appointment as Clerical Supervisor. The following year, both positions were eliminated. Lipsey's position ended with his retirement in 1978.

scopecontent.p: This collection contains records about the physical facilities of the Philadelphia Museum of Art. The materials are arranged into series by creating office: records of Building Superintendents George Barbour (1946-1972), Alan Corson (1962-1969), and Robert Lipsey (1968-1978); records of Engineers William G. Allen (1937-1959) and Walter Cheatham (1969-1976); records of Administrative Services Officer Jane Edmiston (1953-1972). The last series consists of a ledger inventory of drawings under the jurisdiction of the current Manager of Engineering Services. The work of the Superintendent and Engineer is closely related and sometimes records are interfiled. Subjects documented by the records include: architects and contractors; manufacturers; mechanical and electrical systems; personnel matters; specific Museum sections, galleries, special events, and exhibitions; WPA construction projects; . Files pertaining to construction and maintenance include blueprints, job specifications and work orders, purchase requests, contract information, product brochures. Other materials in the collection are attendance reports, reports from the Park Houses, city offices and special projects, personnel files, correspondence and internal memoranda, and accident and damage reports. The ledger of drawings includes a catalog listing of drawings in ledger, numbers 700-2459, 1937-1965; and a catalog listing of drawings in notebook from Dec. 1974 to May 1975 and from May 1976.
